alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 12:44PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following county, Hancock. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1244 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ellsworth, Bar Harbor, Blue Hill, Deer Isle, Castine, Stonington, Penobscot Township, Hancock, Franklin, Lamoine, Tremont, Trenton, Surry, Penobscot, Sullivan, Sedgwick, Brooksville, Brooklin, Winter Harbor and Swans Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
